Kedington Library

Manager: Dawn Bamford

Community Centre, Arms Lane, Kedington
CB9 7QQ

  • Tel: 01440 703449
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Friends of Kedington Library
  • Facebook

Branch updates

  • The Friends of Kedington Library are looking for a volunteer treasurer.
  • Baby Bounce and Tot Rock are currently not running at this library.

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday Closed
Tuesday 1130 - 1300, 1330 - 1800
Wednesday 0900 – 1300, 1330 – 1630
Thursday 1300 - 1700
Friday 1100 - 1500
Saturday 0900 – 1300
Sunday Closed

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: available
  • Refreshments: available

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow an iPad
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Cancelled until further notice due to refurbishment work., N/A

Songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers.

Find out more about Wordplay

Craft activities: for primary school age children

Sunday, 1400-1600

Saturday Science Club: for 10-15 year-olds

first Saturday of the month, 0930-1030

Storytime: stories and rhymes for pre-school children

Thursday, 1600-1630

Find out more about Wordplay

Older people's events

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Friday, 1100-1300

Reading groups

Ketton Bookworms reading group

first Tuesday of the month, 1400-1500

Ketton Characters play reading group: all welcome

second Tuesday of the month, 1400-1500

The Secret Reader: for ages 11+

last Tuesday of the month, 1700-1800

Chat about fiction and non-fiction with a drink and snack.

IT help

Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance

Tuesday, All day

Arts, crafts & games

Knit and Natter knitting group

Wednesday, 0930-1100

Ketton Lunar Society

second Wednesday of the month, 1930

Chat about fascinating twentieth-century scientists and the impact of their ideas on modern society.
